page.title: 06NEW CHESHIRE SALT WORKS.
page.content: The New Cheshire Salt Works, Lower Wincham, is the third largest salt manufacturer in the U.K. after I.C.I.(who work the country's only remaining salt mine at nearby Winsford) and British Salt at Middlewich, Cheshire. Unlike the Lion Salt Works (q.v.), New Cheshire extract salt from brine using the much more efficient vacuum method. The company was founded by Alfred Stubbs in the twenties and has been associated with his family for five generations. Concentrated brine is pumped up from a borehole beneath the factory, treated with sodium carbonate and lime to remove impurities and then heated up in the vacuum extraction system. Over 1,000 tons of salt are produced each week, 25% of which is sold through retail outlets under the brand name of "Selva".
